channel.title: [PI] Skillcape shop error [PI]
channel.description:
Whenever I click "Talk to Wise Old Man" I freeze/get a error in my CMD (Client) That's because, I have coins & items in my invent, anyone know how to fix?
Also I have these 3-4 items, how do I remove? I looked everywhere.
[URL=http://img838.imageshack.us/i/jgjghjghj.png/][IMG]http://img838.imageshack.us/img838/756/jgjghjghj.png[/img][/URL]

item.title: [PI] Skillcape shop error [PI]
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

My bad, wasn’t paying attention.

Here:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) {
	for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
		if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
			Client all = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
			String userTitle = "";
			switch(c.playerRights) {
				case 0:
					userTitle = "Player";
				break;
				case 1:
					userTitle = "Moderator";
				break;
				case 3:
					userTitle = "Admin";
				break;
				case 4:
					userTitle = "Player";
				break;
			}
			if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("YOUR NAME"))
				userTitle = "Owner";
			all.sendMessage("[" + userTitle + "]" + " " + Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +" - " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");
		}
	}
}

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Skillcape shop error [PI]
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { Client all = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; String userTitle = ""; switch(playerRights) { case 0: userTitle = "Player"; break; case 1: userTitle = "Moderator"; break; case 3: userTitle = "Admin"; break; case 4: userTitle = "Player"; break; } if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("YOUR NAME")) userTitle = "Owner"; all.sendMessage("[" + userTitle + "]" + " " + Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +" - " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); }
That should do it.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Skillcape shop error [PI]
item.dc:creator: @_Haste1 #Haste
item.description:
@_Haste1 wrote:

Jc22493:

Maybe it’s an unrecognized or ‘out-of-bounds’ item that’s in your shop. Sorry, I’m not too good with clients.

Jc, will you help me for one last time? I need a yell that’s for Donator and mod+

And has yell like [Mod] [Admin] [Owner] [Donator]
And a sendMessage that says… You cannot use this feature, donate $10 to use it.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; if(c.playerRights == 0){ c.sendMessage("Donate $10 to access this feature"); return; } switch (c.playerRights){ case 0: /*c2.sendMessage("+Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName)+": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5))+"");*/ break; case 1: c2.sendMessage("[Mod]"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); break; case 2: c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Yell]</col><img=2>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); break; case 3: c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Yell]</col><img=2>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); break; case 4: c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Yell]</col><img=3>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); break; case 5: c2.sendMessage("<col=255>[Yell]</col><img=5>"+ Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +": " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +""); break; } } } }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Skillcape shop error [PI]
item.dc:creator: @_Haste1 #Haste
item.description:
@_Haste1 wrote:

Jc22493:

Probably the shops configuration file. Also, show the error or message on the command prompt please.

I gave myself all 99 stats, in the character file and whenever I try to trade "Wise Old Man" My client freezes, and I get this client CMD error.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Skillcape shop error [PI]
item.dc:creator: @_Haste1 #Haste
item.description:
@_Haste1 wrote:

Jc22493:

That usually happens when you have too many items in the shop. In your case, it may be a ‘tab error’ or just an item with an invalid ID.

Where would this be located, do you know? ;s

Read full topic

item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

That usually happens when you have too many items in the shop. In your case, it may be a ‘tab error’ or just an item with an invalid ID.
